New Records: Virat Kohli almost equaled the record for most hundreds in ODIs
Shubman Gill became the quickest to reach 2000 ODI runs
Key Match Events: Kohli out for 95 but India win
Jadeja's brilliant direct hit to dismiss Steve Smith
India defended 10 runs in the final over to win by 1 run
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and decided to bowl
Dew was a significant factor in the match
Rohit Sharma was concerned about the outfield condition
Hardik Pandya was injured, affecting India's bowling balance
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed pride in the team's resilience
Rohit Sharma remarked that winning the series was a significant morale booster
Kane Williamson highlighted the importance of adaptability
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side
Dew and pitch conditions were crucial factors
Lockie Ferguson took the first two wickets
Mitchell Santner was pivotal in breaking the partnership
Others: The BCCI groundsmen used APSHA 80 to minimize dew impact
Players were cautious about the outfield condition due to slipperiness
